comments.body:
Can we define DEVICE_SYCL in a sycl-specific header? 

It would be nice to demonstrate by example that you don't need to add code to core TensorFlow for new devices.

Do you have any preferences on where DEVICE_SYCL should go? 

types.h seemed like a good place since it is included by all Ops. 
That makes Op registration easy.

I guess since we're registering all the kernels in the same files as CPU and GPU, this is fine.  Otherwise I'd have suggested defining something like a sycl/defs.h header where common SYCL-specific defines could go.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +71,75 @@extern const char* const DEVICE_CPU;   // "CPU"
extern const char* const DEVICE_GPU;   // "GPU"
extern const char* const DEVICE_SYCL;  // "SYCL"

typedef gtl::InlinedVector<MemoryType, 4> MemoryTypeVector;
